title: Captain Jack
content:
is dead.

But his music will live on forever as will his spirit in the hearts of his fans.

[img]http://www.captain-jack.de/pics11/cj1.jpg[/img]
So young....-----------------
[img]http://jamba.nl/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Rocket.gif[/img]
Jamster! rules!

title: Re: Captain Jack
content:
I just found an MP3 by him hidden on my computer somewhere recently, and thought about him again after I read there will be a Docter Who spin off by the same name (about a completely different character who happens to share his name).
Strange to read he has passed on now.
His music was... not favourite style I suppose, but it was still fun to listen to.
May he rest in peace.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Captain Jack
content:
Too bad. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] I read some days ago that he was taken to hospital, it's very sad it turned to this. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

Rest in peace.

(I had no idea Djaser was his fan.)Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Captain Jack
content:
I think that Crazy Frog, Captain Jack, Queen and Beethoven are pretty much on the same line. I don't about Weird Al his music is not as serious as all those other artists.
But if that makes you happy, Queen and Beethoven stand left to my captain Jack cds.-----------------
